poi.name: Victoria Peak
poi.intro: Hong Kong's most famous viewpoint offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city skyline and Victoria Harbour.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR + Peak Tram 25-30 minutes
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Amazing sunset views! Must visit at golden hour - absolutely breathtaking!

poi.name: Star Ferry
poi.intro: Historic ferry service providing scenic harbour crossing between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central/Tsim Sha Tsui MTR 5-10 minutes walk
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Classic Hong Kong experience! Cheap way to see the harbour - very nostalgic!

poi.name: Avenue of Stars
poi.intro: Waterfront promenade celebrating Hong Kong's film industry with stunning harbour views.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Tsim Sha Tsui MTR 5-8 minutes walk
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Perfect for evening stroll! Great photo spots with harbour backdrop!

poi.name: Temple Street Night Market
poi.intro: Vibrant night market famous for street food, fortune telling, and local atmosphere.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Yau Ma Tei MTR 3-5 minutes walk
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Authentic local atmosphere! Great street food and unique shopping finds!

poi.name: Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade
poi.intro: Beautiful waterfront walkway perfect for evening strolls and harbour views.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Tsim Sha Tsui MTR direct access
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Perfect for photos! Best harbour views in the city - especially beautiful at sunset!

poi.name: Wong Tai Sin Temple
poi.intro: Colorful Taoist temple famous for fortune-telling and wish fulfillment.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Wong Tai Sin MTR 2-3 minutes walk
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Very colorful and vibrant! Locals say wishes come true here - worth trying!

poi.name: Central District
poi.intro: Hong Kong's financial heart with modern skyscrapers and shopping centers.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR direct access
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Impressive skyscrapers! Great for shopping and business district exploration!

poi.name: Ladies' Market
poi.intro: Bustling street market in Mong Kok perfect for bargain shopping and local snacks.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Mong Kok MTR 3-5 minutes walk
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Great for bargain hunting! Remember to negotiate prices - very lively atmosphere!

poi.name: Ocean Park
poi.intro: Marine-themed amusement park with thrilling rides and animal exhibits.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Admiralty MTR + Bus 629 30-40 minutes
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Fun for all ages! The cable car and roller coasters are amazing - full day needed!

poi.name: Hong Kong Disneyland
poi.intro: Magical Disney theme park with classic attractions and unique Hong Kong touches.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Disneyland Resort MTR direct line 45-60 minutes
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Magical experience! Smaller than other Disney parks but very well designed!

poi.name: Big Buddha (Tian Tan)
poi.intro: Majestic bronze Buddha statue on Lantau Island accessible by scenic cable car.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Tung Chung MTR + Ngong Ping Cable Car 45-60 minutes
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Peaceful and spiritual! The cable car ride offers stunning mountain views!

poi.name: Symphony of Lights
poi.intro: Spectacular multimedia light show illuminating Victoria Harbour's skyline nightly.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Tsim Sha Tsui MTR 5 minutes to waterfront
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Spectacular every night at 8pm! Best viewed from Tsim Sha Tsui promenade!

poi.name: Man Mo Temple
poi.intro: Historic temple dedicated to literature and war gods, famous for giant incense coils.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Sheung Wan MTR 10-15 minutes walk
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Atmospheric and mystical! The giant incense coils create amazing photos!

poi.name: Hong Kong Museum of History
poi.intro: Comprehensive museum showcasing Hong Kong's rich cultural and natural history.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Tsim Sha Tsui MTR 10-15 minutes walk
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Very informative! Great way to understand Hong Kong's fascinating history!

poi.name: Repulse Bay
poi.intro: Beautiful crescent-shaped beach popular for swimming and beachside dining.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR + Bus 6/260 30-40 minutes
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Beautiful beach escape! Perfect for relaxing and swimming in the city!

poi.name: Stanley Market
poi.intro: Charming seaside market town perfect for shopping and waterfront dining.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR + Bus 6/260 40-50 minutes
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Charming seaside atmosphere! Great for souvenirs and waterfront dining!

poi.name: IFC Mall
poi.intro: Upscale shopping mall in Central with luxury brands and harbour views.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR direct access
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Luxury shopping paradise! Great harbour views from upper floors!

poi.name: Lan Kwai Fong
poi.intro: Famous nightlife district with bars, clubs, and international dining options.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR 5-10 minutes walk
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Vibrant nightlife scene! Great mix of locals and expats - party until late!

poi.name: Chi Lin Nunnery
poi.intro: Serene Buddhist complex featuring traditional wooden architecture and lotus ponds.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Diamond Hill MTR 5-8 minutes walk
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Peaceful oasis! Beautiful traditional architecture and serene gardens!

poi.name: Hong Kong Space Museum
poi.intro: Interactive science museum with planetarium shows and space exploration exhibits.
poi.traffic: ğŸš‡ Tsim Sha Tsui MTR 5-8 minutes walk
poi.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Great for kids and adults! The planetarium shows are mind-blowing!

food.name: Tim Ho Wan
food.intro: World's cheapest Michelin-starred restaurant famous for BBQ pork buns.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Sham Shui Po MTR 5-10 minutes walk
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Highly recommended! Worth the wait - BBQ pork buns are incredible!

food.name: Kam Wah Cafe
food.intro: Traditional cha chaan teng serving authentic Hong Kong-style breakfast and tea.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Mong Kok MTR 8-12 minutes walk
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Authentic local experience! Pineapple buns with butter are amazing!

food.name: Lin Heung Lau
food.intro: Historic noodle shop famous for wonton noodles with fresh shrimp dumplings.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR 10-15 minutes walk
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Traditional atmosphere! Fresh wontons and perfect noodle texture!

food.name: Yung Kee Restaurant
food.intro: Legendary Cantonese restaurant renowned for roast goose and traditional dishes.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR 8-12 minutes walk
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Famous roast goose! Historic restaurant with excellent traditional flavors!

food.name: Sing Heung Yuen
food.intro: Iconic street-side stall serving tomato noodles and Hong Kong-style milk tea.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR 5-8 minutes walk
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Unique tomato noodles! Street food at its best - very authentic experience!

food.name: Kau Kee Restaurant
food.intro: Famous for beef brisket noodles in rich, flavorful broth since 1920s.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR 12-15 minutes walk
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Best beef brisket! Rich broth and tender meat - a Hong Kong classic!

food.name: Tai Cheong Bakery
food.intro: Historic bakery famous for egg tarts, once favored by the last governor.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR 8-10 minutes walk
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Perfect egg tarts! Crispy pastry and smooth custard - must try!

food.name: Amis
food.intro: Traditional dim sum restaurant with classic pushcart service and harbor views.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Wan Chai MTR 10-15 minutes walk
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Traditional dim sum! Pushcart service adds authentic charm!

food.name: Tsui Wah Restaurant
food.intro: Popular chain serving Hong Kong comfort food and crispy buns 24/7.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Multiple locations - various MTR stations
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Great comfort food! Open 24/7 - perfect for late night cravings!

food.name: Australia Dairy Company
food.intro: No-frills cha chaan teng famous for scrambled eggs and steamed milk pudding.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Jordan MTR 5-8 minutes walk
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Unique scrambled eggs! Fast service but worth the rushed atmosphere!

food.name: Lung King Heen
food.intro: Three Michelin-starred Cantonese restaurant with exquisite dim sum and harbour views.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR 5-10 minutes walk
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Exceptional dining! Three Michelin stars well deserved - unforgettable experience!

food.name: Amber
food.intro: Two Michelin-starred French restaurant offering innovative cuisine and wine pairings.

food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Innovative French cuisine! Wine pairings are perfect - truly special occasion dining!

food.name: Caprice
food.intro: Three Michelin-starred French restaurant with classic techniques and elegant atmosphere.
food.traffic: ğŸš‡ Central MTR 5-8 minutes walk
food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Classic French excellence! Elegant atmosphere and impeccable service!

food.name: Harlan's
food.intro: Michelin-starred French restaurant with open kitchen and counter dining concept.

food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Interactive dining! Watching chefs work adds to the amazing experience!

food.name: Gaddi's
food.intro: Historic European fine dining restaurant with colonial charm and impeccable service.

food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Colonial elegance! Historic atmosphere with exceptional European cuisine!

food.name: Kam's Roast Goose
food.intro: Michelin-recommended restaurant specializing in perfectly roasted goose and char siu.

food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Authentic char siu! Traditional flavors and great value for money!

food.userComment: ğŸ’¬ Classic milk tea! Reliable chain with consistent quality and local atmosphere!
